query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Intra due cibi, distanti e moventi 2 d’un modo, prima si morria di fame, 3 che liber’ omo l’un recasse ai denti;
4 sì si starebbe un agno intra due brame 5 di fieri lupi, igualmente temendo; 6 sì si starebbe un cane intra due dame:
7 per che, s’i’ mi tacea, me non riprendo, 8 da li miei dubbi d’un modo sospinto, 9 poi ch’era necessario, né commendo.

Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Io mi tacea, ma ’l mio disir dipinto 11 m’era nel viso, e ’l dimandar con ello, 12 più caldo assai che per parlar distinto.
query.result: 10 I was silent, but my painted desire 11 it was on my face, and the asking with it, 12 much hotter indeed than to speak distinctly

13 Faith so Beatrice as made Danïello, 14 Nebuchadnezzar lifting from anger, 15 who had made him unjustly a fool;
16 and said: «I see well how it pulls you 17 one and another desire, so that your care 18 itself binds so that out not breathes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Tu argomenti: “Se ’l buon voler dura, 20 la vïolenza altrui per qual ragione 21 di meritar mi scema la misura?”.
query.result: 19 You argue: “If the good will lasts, 20 the other's violence for what reason 21 does the measure of merit shrink for me?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Ancor di dubitar ti dà cagione 23 parer tornarsi l’anime a le stelle, 24 secondo la sentenza di Platone.
query.result: 22 Even doubting gives you cause 23 seems to turn the souls back to the stars, 24 according to the sentence of Plato

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Queste son le question che nel tuo velle 26 pontano igualmente; e però pria 27 tratterò quella che più ha di felle.
query.result: 25 These are the questions that in your will 26 point equally; and therefore first 27 I will treat the one that has the most gall

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 D’i Serafin colui che più s’india, 29 Moïsè, Samuel, e quel Giovanni 30 che prender vuoli, io dico, non Maria,
31 non hanno in altro cielo i loro scanni 32 che questi spirti che mo t’appariro, 33 né hanno a l’esser lor più o meno anni;
34 ma tutti fanno bello il primo giro, 35 e differentemente han dolce vita 36 per sentir più e men l’etterno spiro.

Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Qui si mostraro, non perché sortita 38 sia questa spera lor, ma per far segno 39 de la celestïal c’ha men salita.
query.result: 37 Here they showed themselves, not because this hope of theirs has arisen, 38 but to make a sign 39 of the celestial that has less ascent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Così parlar conviensi al vostro ingegno, 41 però che solo da sensato apprende 42 ciò che fa poscia d’intelletto degno.
query.result: 40 Thus speaking is fitting to your intellect, 41 however that only the sensible learns, 42 that which later does of worthy intellect.

43 For this the Scripture condescends 44 to your faculty, and foot and hand 45 attributes to God and other intends;
46 and Holy Church with human aspect 47 Gabriel and Michael represent you, 48 and the other that Tobit made healthy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Quel che Timeo de l’anime argomenta 50 non è simile a ciò che qui si vede, 51 però che, come dice, par che senta.
query.result: 49 That which Timeo argues about the souls 50 is not similar to that which here is seen, 51 however that, as he says, seems to feel.

52 He says that the soul returns to its star, 53 believing that therefore it is decided 54 when nature gave it by form;
55 and perhaps its sentence is of another kind 56 that the voice does not sound, and being can 57 with intention not to be mocked.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 S’elli intende tornare a queste ruote 59 l’onor de la influenza e ’l biasmo, forse 60 in alcun vero suo arco percuote.
query.result: 58 If he intends to return to these wheels 59 the honor of the influence and the bias, perhaps 60 in some true his bow strikes

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Questo principio, male inteso, torse 62 già tutto il mondo quasi, sì che Giove, 63 Mercurio e Marte a nominar trascorse.
query.result: 61 This principle, badly understood, twisted 62 already almost the whole world, so that Jupiter, 63 Mercury and Mars, to name, passed

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 L’altra dubitazion che ti commove 65 ha men velen, però che sua malizia 66 non ti poria menar da me altrove.
query.result: 64 The other doubt that moves you 65 has less venom, however that its malice 66 would not lead you elsewhere from me

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Parere ingiusta la nostra giustizia 68 ne li occhi d’i mortali, è argomento 69 di fede e non d’eretica nequizia.
query.result: 67 Unjust seeming our justice 68 in the eyes of mortals, it is argument 69 of faith and not of heretical wickedness

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Ma perché puote vostro accorgimento 71 ben penetrare a questa veritate, 72 come disiri, ti farò contento.
query.result: 70 But why can your understanding 71 well penetrate this truth, 72 as you desire, I will make you content.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Se vïolenza è quando quel che pate 74 nïente conferisce a quel che sforza, 75 non fuor quest’ alme per essa scusate:
76 ché volontà, se non vuol, non s’ammorza, 77 ma fa come natura face in foco, 78 se mille volte vïolenza il torza.
query.result:
73 If violence is when that which suffers 74 nothing confers to that which forces, 75 were not these souls excused by it:
76 for will, if it does not want, does not become angry, 77 but does as nature does in fire, 78 if a thousand times violence twists it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Per che, s’ella si piega assai o poco, 80 segue la forza; e così queste fero 81 possendo rifuggir nel santo loco.
query.result: 79 Therefore, if it bends much or little, 80 it follows the force; and thus these I bear 81 being able to flee in the holy place.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Se fosse stato lor volere intero, 83 come tenne Lorenzo in su la grada, 84 e fece Muzio a la sua man severo,
85 così l’avria ripinte per la strada 86 ond’ eran tratte, come fuoro sciolte; 87 ma così salda voglia è troppo rada.
query.result:
82 If it had been their whole will, 83 as Lorenzo held on the step, 84 and made Muzio at his hand severe,
85 thus he would have repainted it along the road 86 where they were drawn, as they were loosened; 87 but such a firm will is too rare.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E per queste parole, se ricolte 89 l’hai come dei, è l’argomento casso 90 che t’avria fatto noia ancor più volte.
query.result: 88 And for these words, if gathered 89 you have them as gods, it is the case argument 90 that would have bored you even more times

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Ma or ti s’attraversa un altro passo 92 dinanzi a li occhi, tal che per te stesso 93 non usciresti: pria saresti lasso.
query.result: 91 But now another step crosses you 92 in front of the eyes, such that for yourself 93 you would not exit: first you would be weary

100 Many feasts already, brother, occurred 101 that, to flee danger, against grateful 102 it was made of that which to do was not agreed;
103 as Almeone, who, of this prayed 104 by his father, his own mother extinguished, 105 for not to lose pity he made himself ruthless.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 A questo punto voglio che tu pense 107 che la forza al voler si mischia, e fanno 108 sì che scusar non si posson l’offense.
query.result: 106 At this point I want you to think 107 that force to will mixes, and they make 108 so that to excuse the offenses cannot be done

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Voglia assoluta non consente al danno; 110 ma consentevi in tanto in quanto teme, 111 se si ritrae, cadere in più affanno.

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Però, quando Piccarda quello spreme, 113 de la voglia assoluta intende, e io 114 de l’altra; sì che ver diciamo insieme».
query.result: 112 However, when Piccarda squeezes that, 113 of the absolute will understands, and I 114 of the other; so that truly we say together».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Cotal fu l’ondeggiar del santo rio 116 ch’uscì del fonte ond’ ogne ver deriva; 117 tal puose in pace uno e altro disio.

Please translate each line literally into English.
118 «O amanza del primo amante, o diva», 119 diss’ io appresso, «il cui parlar m’inonda 120 e scalda sì, che più e più m’avviva,
121 non è l’affezion mia tanto profonda, 122 che basti a render voi grazia per grazia; 123 ma quei che vede e puote a ciò risponda.
query.result:
118 “O amanza of the first lover, o goddess,” 119 said I thereafter, “the whose speech floods me 120 and warms so, that more and more revives me,
121 it is not my affection so deep, 122 that suffices to render you grace for grace; 123 but he who sees and can answer to that.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Io veggio ben che già mai non si sazia 125 nostro intelletto, se ’l ver non lo illustra 126 di fuor dal qual nessun vero si spazia.
query.result: 124 I see well that already never it is sated 125 our intellect, if the truth does not illustrate it 126 from outside of which no true one wanders

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Posasi in esso, come fera in lustra, 128 tosto che giunto l’ha; e giugner puollo: 129 se non, ciascun disio sarebbe frustra.
query.result: 127 He settled in it, like a beast in a mirror, 128 as soon as he has arrived; and to reach the pull: 129 otherwise, each desire would be in vain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Nasce per quello, a guisa di rampollo, 131 a piè del vero il dubbio; ed è natura 132 ch’al sommo pinge noi di collo in collo.
query.result: 130 It is born for that, in the manner of a sprout, 131 at the foot of truth the doubt; and it is nature 132 that to the summit paints us neck to neck.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Questo m’invita, questo m’assicura 134 con reverenza, donna, a dimandarvi 135 d’un’altra verità che m’è oscura.
query.result: 133 This invites me, this assures me 134 with reverence, lady, to ask you 135 of another truth that is dark to me

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 Io vo’ saper se l’uom può sodisfarvi 137 ai voti manchi sì con altri beni, 138 ch’a la vostra statera non sien parvi».
query.result: 136 I want to know if man can satisfy you 137 to the vows you lack thus with other goods, 138 that to your balance they are not equal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Beatrice mi guardò con li occhi pieni 140 di faville d’amor così divini, 141 che, vinta, mia virtute diè le reni,
142 e quasi mi perdei con li occhi chini.
query.result:
139 Beatrice looked at me with the eyes full 140 of sparks of love so divine, 141 that, conquered, my virtue gave the kidneys,
142 and almost I lost myself with the eyes downcast.
